content: The primary crops grown in Meerut are sugarcane, wheat, rice, and mangoes. Sugarcane is the main crop and Meerut is one of the largest producers of sugar in India. The sugarcane grown in Meerut is of high quality and is used for making jaggery and sweets as well. The wheat and rice grown in Meerut are also of high quality and contribute significantly to India's food industry. The fertile land and suitable climate of Meerut make it favorable for the production of high-quality crops. The mangoes of Meerut are also famous for their taste and aroma, contributing to the fruit industry of India. Overall, the crops grown in Meerut have contributed significantly to India's food industry by providing high-quality raw materials and enhancing the country's agricultural production.
